Author: jl777c#5810
Content: out of curiosity how to do assure consensus when using floating point?

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: I would have to ask my math guy

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: Hiyatus

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: floating point is not consensus safe across all OS, compilers, etc

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: huh.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it could easily end up off by a satoshi on different nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and then fork

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: I'll bring that up with him the moment he's up again. I have Peter Bushnell rebasing me in a few weeks. He was going to audit the code for me too so maybe he would have picked up on that but thank you for bringing it to my attention..

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: yeah i understand that even just 1 sat could throw everything out..

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: If this were to happen, how soon would it occur and under what conditions?

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: I'm more than 2 months into my 60 month inflation period and so far we have had no issue's.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3730019/why-not-use-double-or-float-to-represent-currency/3730040

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: Thank you

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it would depend on how many different nodes end up with slightly different floating point libraries

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: either as a software lib or from CPU

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not guarantee to create problems

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you cant guarantee it wont

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so unless you are very very careful, it could create a fork in some rare cases, but a simple thing would be numbers that dont divide evenly and how rounding is handled. with your massive equation above, it seems the risk for ending up being off by 1 satoshi is there, but would need some intensive verification across all the likely node floating point variations, Intel CPUs, AMD CPU and if you run on androids natively (this is likely where issues can happen) and also across OS

Author: Calem | [x0z] | zero-zed.com#5181
Content: ok cool. well not cool, but its good i know this.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is usually much less work to avoid all this by not using floating point, but in your case it seems it is needed. Maybe some pregenerated table of uint64_t is the way to go

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: assetchains can do linear interpolations of a variety of slopes

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: Hi, I have additional question regarding the komodo interest (5 % reward). The time elapsed is counted from nLockTime so if I put nLockTime lets say a few days before current time do I get a bigger interest? I see that in Agama you are setting nLockTime as currenttime - 777

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you cant backdate nLocktime very much, and nLocktime needs to be more than the median time of the 17 block window, which is about 8 minutes in the past

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I rounded to 777 to give a bit of room

Content: yes, it just needs to be able to create a linkable library (into komodod) and to call the C++ functions inside komodod
